thread.title: Jonas Olsson quits West Brom to join Swedish club Djurgarden IF two months before the end of the season
thread.title_full: Jonas Olsson quits West Brom to join Swedish club Djurgarden IF two months before the end of the season

author: dwright
title: Jonas Olsson quits West Brom to join Swedish club Djurgarden IF two months before the end of the season
text:
EFL swede shock Jonas Olsson quits West Brom to join Swedish club Djurgarden IF two months before the end of the season 
Baggies agree to release centre-back Olsson from contract early after nine year career at The Hawthorns By Duncan Wright 23rd March 2017, 11:06 am Updated: 23rd March 2017, 11:20 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JONAS OLSSON has quit West Brom two months before the end of the season to join Swedish side Djurgarden IF. 
The Baggies have agreed to cancel the giant defender’s contract early so he can link up with his new club before their new campaign begins at the start of April. Reuters 3 Jonas Olsson has quit West Brom to move back to Sweden 
The 34-year-old has been one of the key players for West Brom over the past nine years which has seen them finally establish themselves as a genuine Premier League club. 
But he has seen his starting chances limited this season by the form of Jonny Evans and Gareth McAuley, and the chance to extend his career in his native Sweden was too good to turn down. Getty Images 3 Jonas Olsson has been frustrated at spending much of this season on the bench 
Olsson said: “It’s all happened so quickly I’ve not had chance to say a proper farewell to so many people. 
“I will be back at the first chance to do that. But I’m really grateful to the club for helping me sort out this transfer. 
“I still feel I have a few good years in me but such is the quality of the competition at Albion for places in my position, it was getting harder and harder to see a first team opportunity. Most read in football Joe Hart shows incredible sportsmanship as he fist bumps Lukas Podolski after German scores screamer mark of respect FA plan tribute to security services and victims against Lithuania on Sunday after terror attack Team news Jake Livemore and Michael Keane start for England in Germany as Gareth Southgate experiments with 3-4-3 new look Jake Livermore starts and Michael Keane makes debut as England boss Gareth Southgate tries out 3-4-3 experiment NEVER MOVED SO FAST Manchester United flop Bastian Schweinsteiger is seen moving out of Cheshire mansion just one day after MLS switch is announced Cheltenham gold Real Madrid look to sign ex-Tottenham flop and Cheltenham Town loanee Yuri Berchiche West Brom 3-1 Arsenal : Gunners’ top-four chase suffers major setback 
"Albion has been and will always be a huge part of my life and it is great to feel I am leaving it in such a strong position." 
The centre-back was almost a permanent fixture at the heart of the West Brom defence for much of his time with the club. 
He made 253 appearances for the Baggies over his career, scoring 14 goals, and was a huge favourite with the supporters for his uncompromising style of play. Getty Images
